PrimitiveGeo

class pyrit.geometry.PrimitiveGeo(dim: int, physical_tag: int, tag=None)

Bases: ABC

Abstract class for primitive geometry object that can be added directly to GMSH.

Methods

add_to_gmsh

Add the PrimitiveGeo object in GMSH

remove

Remove the PrimitiveGeo object from GMSH

reset_tag

Sets its own tag and the tags of all contained entities to None.

rotate

Rotate the PrimitiveGeo object.

translate

Translate the PrimitiveGeo object.

Attributes

tag

physical_tag

added

Gives True if the entity has beed added to gmsh and False if not

dim

Get the dimension of the PrimitiveGeo object
abstract property dim: int

Get the dimension of the PrimitiveGeo object

The following dimensions exist:

0: Point 1: Line 2: Surface 3: Volume

Returns

The dimension

Return type

int

abstract property added: bool

Gives True if the entity has beed added to gmsh and False if not

Returns

True if added in gmsh False if not

Return type

bool

abstract reset_tag() → None

Sets its own tag and the tags of all contained entities to None.

Return type

None

abstract add_to_gmsh()

Add the PrimitiveGeo object in GMSH

Return type

None.

abstract remove(recursive=True)

Remove the PrimitiveGeo object from GMSH

Parameters

recursive (bool, optional) – If True, all entities that define this entity are removed as well. Default is True

Return type

None.

abstract translate(dx: float, dy: float, dz: float)

Translate the PrimitiveGeo object.

Parameters

  • dx (float) – Translation in x-direction

  • dy (float) – Translation in y-direction

  • dz (float) – Translation in z-direction

Return type

None.

abstract rotate(angle_x: float, angle_y: float, angle_z: float, rotation_origin: Optional[ndarray] = None)

Rotate the PrimitiveGeo object.

Parameters

  • angle_x (float) – Rotation angle around x-axis in radian

  • angle_y (float) – Rotation angle around y-axis in radian

  • angle_z (float) – Rotation angle around z-axis in radian

  • rotation_origin (np.ndarray, optional) – The origin around which is rotated. By default (0,0,0) is taken

Return type

None.
